website_summaries.verdict: A cheaper alternative to the PDP Universal Media Remote.
pros: If you prefer your remotes uncluttered, this PDP remote is an excellent choice at a low price
Includes standard PlayStation buttons and is designed to work smoothly with PlayStation 4 apps
Unlike most remotes, this one can be used to turn your PS4 on and off
cons: No keyboard means typing is as much of a hassle as it is with the DualShock 4

customer_reviews.title: Guzzles batteries and suddenly died
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is far better than trying to use the PS4 controller for DVD/Bluray navigation. The arrow buttons are a little too sensitive and I double-click them all the time accidentally but that's a minor issue. UPDATE: it seems to chew through batteries pretty quickly (already blew through a pair of new AAA's in less than a month) and like another reviewer, mine has suddenly stopped working even with fresh batteries. Will have to return if it doesn't start working again in a day or two... UPDATE 2: Never worked again and it's too late to return to Amazon. Will be contacting the manufacturer. Shame.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bernhardt

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it for everyday use.
customer_reviews.text: Works good- only problem is that they go through batteries like crazy!!! And it has a “battery saving function “ that basically turns the remote off to save battery. I guess it’s like a sleep mode. The remote shuts down if not in use. Well you can be watching a movie and need to pause. But the remote won’t work because it’s sleeping. It just ends up being super annoying. You have to press the buttons multiple times to wake it up- and by then you’ve pressed it too many times. It’s aggravating. I’ve had it for about a month or so and I’ve had to replace the batteries more than 3 times.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra G.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, very happy.
customer_reviews.text: I had the universal media remote for PS4 before I got this and I thought that remote worked fine but there were a few things I didn't like about it. The biggest issue with the universal remote was that it took a few seconds to "wake up" after a few minutes of inactivity. This new remote doesn't do that, it's almost instant. The size is really nice and it controls your blu-rays and your apps perfectly (Netflix, YouTube, Amazon Prime, and others) My only complaint is that if your PS4 is off any button on the remote will turn it on so you have to be careful not to accidentally bump it. Other than that, very nice remote.
customer_reviews.author: Fozzie

customer_reviews.title: Overall, I like it
customer_reviews.text: Much better than using a game controller for movies! Though I don’t like that it doesn’t have a dedicated menu button for DVDs and Blu-ray discs. You just have to remember that “square” is the menu button, “triangle” brings up other options, and “circle” acts as a back button. So that’s kind of dumb. It is nice that you don’t have to point the remote at the PS4 for it to work, though, since it works via Bluetooth. It also feels nice in your hand, and looks nice
customer_reviews.author: thechubbygoomba

customer_reviews.title: Absolute piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: Bought it and it worked for a few months until the batteries needed replaced. Then never worked again. I noticed my daughter wasn’t using it to watch movies on the PS4 and asked where it was. She said the batteries died and then it wouldn’t connect. I spent a frustrating hour connecting then disconnecting over and over again. Replaces the batteries 3 more times. It’ll say it’s connected but won’t work. The red lighting will sporadically come one when you press a button but it won’t respond. Apparently it is disposable - works for 3-4 months then stops. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: reading all night

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Before this remote, we were constantly swapping between 2 wireless PS4 controllers. They didn't hold a charge for very long and my husband griped at every changing of the controller. I've found that this thing burns through 2 AAA batteries approximately every 3 months. I will gladly go through 8 batteries in a year instead of dealing with those 2 wireless controllers. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: J Leigh

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS! WILL STOP WORKING AFTER A MONTH!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS! IT WILL STOP WORKING SOON AFTER YOU GET IT! AMAZON DOES NOT ALLOW FOR 0 STAR REVIEWS I should have learned my lesson after having two PDP universal remotes that stopped working each after a month. This one broke down after a month, too, and all it will do is turn on the playstation. I only remember I have it when something else knocks into it and turns it on like it did this morning. This is a garbage product and they should be embarrassed that they put it out. Don't buy it! Just put your money towards a second controller and charge dock - that's money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Lee Bohn

customer_reviews.title: Does Not Last
customer_reviews.text: Update: After a few months of having this remote it does not work consistently anymore. We have tried simply changing out the batteries but that does not resolve the issue. Basically the remote does not respond to any buttons being pressed and it is INCREDIBLY frustrating. I didn’t think it would break down so quickly.. I really don’t want to have to pay for another one so soon. ): Buyer beware. I absolutely love this thing! It makes it so much easier to nagicate the PS4 when streaming as I typically do this often as my spouse is the one that plays the games. This is a must have for PS4.
customer_reviews.author: BadWolf

customer_reviews.title: Great remote, but it will kill your batteries fast
customer_reviews.text: Not gonna lie, this remote is really good. I bought after I started using my console more like a media center than a console, and I don't like to use the commands of the player with a PS controller. I've been using it while watching Blu rays, VRV, Netflix, etc, and it works perfectly, but the only inconvenience is how fast it can kill batteries. I put new batteries on it, and they lasted only one month, and I didn't used it that much. If you have rechargeable AAA batteries already or you don't mind buying batteries often this is perfect for you. Otherwise you may want to keep using your PS4 controller.
customer_reviews.author: Abel Fregoso

customer_reviews.title: but burns through batteries like crazy. It also tends to double and triple ...
customer_reviews.text: Has okay connectivity, but burns through batteries like crazy. It also tends to double and triple click menu items almost everytime we use it.
customer_reviews.author: Anna S.

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to take the place of my other remote that I have and use for my PS Vue. Terrible. The instructions say to do one thing and then my PS System told me to do another. Could never get it to even read the device to connect via bluetooth. Not good at all. I did system updates, everything I could think of to get it to connect and nothing worked. I would suggest getting the older remote.
customer_reviews.author: MrPrice_isRight

customer_reviews.title: All great with 1 flaw
customer_reviews.text: I had a remote like this for my ps3 and loved it. So, I thought to purchase one for my ps4. The functions work perfectly with the ps4, the only downside is it appears to require pairing every single time the ps4 is powered back on. It’s been a minor inconvenience but worthy of a star drop since this was not an issue with the ps3 remote. I figure if it is something that wasn’t an issue with the older system why should it be an issue with the newer system.
customer_reviews.author: Public Name

customer_reviews.title: My wife was ecstatic when I bought this. We ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife was ecstatic when I bought this. We are cable cutters and watch all of our programs through the PS4. When she would set the standard controller down it would hit one of the trigger buttons and fast forward or rewind and drive her nuts. This purchase has eliminated all of that. The set up took a couple tries which I attribute to old batteries, but once I got it working I have had no complaints. Definitely, worth the price of admission.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy A. Langdon

customer_reviews.title: It worked fine for about 4 weeks then literally less than a ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this remote because I had cut the cord and went strictly with Sony Vue as my provider. It worked fine for about 4 weeks then literally less than a week past the return deadline, it stops working. I had replaced the batteries and that didn’t not fix the issue. It completely died. Unfortunately I am giving it one star since I cannot return the defective Piece of garbage. While it worked, I would have given it 3 stars. It’s only nominally more convenient than the PS4 controller.
customer_reviews.author: James H Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working After A Couple Months
customer_reviews.text: Product stopped working after a couple months and will no longer sync with PS4.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L Broadus

customer_reviews.title: Loved it, but it suddenly broke.
customer_reviews.text: This thing burned through batteries, so I bought some rechargable AAA’s, problem solved. Then I’m watching a movie, suddenly it freezes, I hit play a few times to try to get it going again. After a minute or two of click buttons all my inputs go through over the course of a few seconds. Then the light on the remote turns off and never turns on again. I’ve had this for about 14 weeks, so I nearly got a dollar a week out of it. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: just like that, haven’t used it since
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about a month, & then just stopped. Changed batteries and continued to show no signs of power. Tried to repair & it never showed up on PS4. Weeks later (today) noticed it is flashing a red light, tried to pair it with PS4 Bluetooth & it detects it this time. I make the selection to register Bluetooth device & it says “The PS4 does not support this Bluetooth device.” Straight up, nothing happened to make it stop working, it just stopped. I was literally holding it navigating PS Vue & selected a channel, I watch for roughly 20 seconds & decide to keep browsing, & then it was dead, just like that, haven’t used it since.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I stream, you stream, we all stream!
customer_reviews.text: The media remote is a perfect companion for my PS4. The PS4 console replaced many of my streaming media devices but using the game controller was not the best thing when streaming content due to it's button sensitivity and short battery life. This remote makes it easy to navigate to the streaming program of our choice. We don't worry about the battery life like we did with the game controller and the remote has all the same functionality as using the controller. The remote arrow buttons are a bit sensitive and sometimes skip ahead a few times when searching for content, but it's a small price to pay for the convenience of having it.
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: Buggy and battery vampire
customer_reviews.text: It's convenient for watching streaming services like Netflix, Hulu, etc. However, it drains batteries at an unnatural rate, and often stops working. This requires either pressing and holding the PS button until it decides to work again, or sometimes pulling a battery and putting it back in. The bugginess of this remote almost completely detracts from the convenience it provides.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Button layout is not intuitive
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy I finally have a media remote for my PS4, as I really only use it for streaming via Netflix, HBO, etc. This gets the job done--works well with all the apps, including YouTube. I'm also very happy with the price--more than reasonable. My only gripe is that the button layout is not intuitive. The XO^[] buttons are merged with the D-pad, and it's super easy to accidentally press O (cancel/back) when you're streaming and meant to fast-forward.
customer_reviews.author: M. Spector

customer_reviews.title: Excellent PS4 Remote
customer_reviews.text: Finally a PS4 remote that works well ('bout time!). Powers on the system from standby mode with no problem. Play, pause, fast fwd, and rewind all work. Tested with Hulu, YouTube, and Netflix so far and functions as expected. Really quick to set up. Nice little remote.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, slow decline to not working.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for 2 months then, stopped connecting, and now will kit even turn on. No blinking red lights on the reconnecting sequence, Playstation does not even see remote, should have bought the better one. Great deal but,. Get what you pay for. Since this was a licensed through Sony Playstation I'm surprised it's not more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Whitley

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these. The first one lasted just a few days, the second lasted a couple months. It would be great if it worked. Now it works if you take the batteries out and then put them back in, but 3-4 seconds later it stops working again. I'm quite disappointed..
customer_reviews.author: Tom Michael

customer_reviews.title: Solid Media Remote for PS4
customer_reviews.text: For me, 95% of my PS4 usage is Netflix, Hulu, YouTube, etc. and this device works perfect for that. Honestly, I mostly bought this for two reasons: 1. The triggers on the PS4 controller ALWAYS get bumped while they sit on my couch and whatever I'm watching it fast-forwarded or rewound (usually at the most critical part of the movie!). 2. My wife constantly drops the PS4 remote/gamepad on the floor and this is cheaper to replace if it's breaks. My only compliant is that the back comes off pretty easy if you drop it (as my wife does quite often), but it hasn't broken yet.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Read some negative reviews for this remote, so it sat in my wishlist forever. Now that I find myself using PS4 for YouTube/Netflix 90% of the time, I bit on this. And I’m glad I did! Synching up was easy. Battery life is excellent; after a month of use, I’m only down one bar on the battery indicator. I no longer worry about nudging/dropping my PS4 controller and skipping the video I’m watching. The only downsides are no headphone jack - which I understand - and some slight lag. If you’ve been considering this remote, I recommend you go for it!
customer_reviews.author: jLeeper

customer_reviews.title: Died...even after limited use
customer_reviews.text: Battery switches...re connection... simply did not matter. The remote stopped working after light 6 months of use. The entire reason this was bought was to not have to use my controller for app usage...sadly it did not fulfill its mission. Avoid buying
customer_reviews.author: O

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to  (well... almost)
customer_reviews.text: It's a really good buy for people who sometimes aren't in their Gaming mood and just want to watch Videos/Movies. The controller has a nice feal to it, perfect weight, and although I thought the buttons where too close together in the middle, it actually helps you to know what buttons you are pressing without looking. Only downside is... L1/L2 and R1/R2 don't work... (I need those for Crunchyroll)
customer_reviews.author: SHF

customer_reviews.title: I use it every day
customer_reviews.text: Would have given 5 stars if the buttons were backlit and it didn't go through batteries like an unstoppable rebel force. You can manually turn it off. Also the buttons around the wheel seem a little too close together for my hands. Its not a deal breaker but its something some of you may not like. Overall id buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Unkle Blufey

customer_reviews.title: A small and sleek PS4 remote that works.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this remote for a few months now, and it has been a great addition to my Playstation. I use PLEX on my Playstation4 and using the Dual Shock Controller can be a pain, this is a fantastic alternative. Pros- · Fits in hand nicely · works seamlessly with Playstation · Is Officially licensed · Good battery life with (2) AAA Batteries. Cons- · None to date I would recommend this to anyone that has struggled with the game controller when watching movies.
customer_reviews.author: Soto's Honest Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Makes PS4 usable as a media player
customer_reviews.text: What Sony did with the PS4 and making it incompatible with ANY real 3rd party home theater management system is inexcusable. The way the PS3 worked with the Logitech Harmony Hub meant I could get anyone who wasn't tech-savvy working with my home theater in about 2 minutes. Now they have to remember the controller buttons to use to play a blu-ray? Really? At least with this, you can work a movie like any other blu-ray player. Simple to setup like other controllers, so that's a big plus. Stays paired and hasn't created a problem
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Game controller needed in order to set up
customer_reviews.text: My PS4 DualShock controller broke. I only used it so that I could connect to Netflix, Hulu etc using my PS4. The remote would probably be great, but in order to connect it to your PS4 and get it working you need a second controller in order to do the setup. And my reason for buying this was that my other controller is broken. So, this remote is useless in my circumstance. But it might work great for someone who also has a game controller. Unfortunately I had to return mine and I ended up ordering a new PS4 DualShock controller.
customer_reviews.author: Caterina

customer_reviews.title: Devourer of AAA Cells
customer_reviews.text: This product would be a fine remote except for the fact that it simply eats up batteries. It is a nice size with basic functionality (although the buttons can tend to stick or not register being pressed), but I’ve recently upgraded to a different remote simply because I got tired of replacing the batteries every month.
customer_reviews.author: MarquisMark

customer_reviews.title: Things to know.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, good to have. Things to know, This remote goes into sleep mode quite fast. If you hit a button give it 2 seconds to wake up. if you get hit a button more than once in frustration it will remember all your commands. . The backplate is kind of flimsy and pops off. . The PS buttons IS quite soft and a cat can walk on the buttons and trigger it. . You might get a little irritated with the arrow buttons have you been have big fingers. .
customer_reviews.author: 702shopper

customer_reviews.title: it was annoying always having to grab a big bulky PlayStation controller ...
customer_reviews.text: Our household has recently cut the cord with satellite TV and gone completely over to streaming services: PlayStation Vue, Netflix and Amazon Prime. With that being said, it was annoying always having to grab a big bulky PlayStation controller every time you want to watch anything and having it die in the middle of the show you're watching. This handy little remote solves that problem! It works great but I do agree with other reviewers about the buttons being too close together. I don't really understand why they made it like that. I have average sized lady hands (not man hands) and still have trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Amy England

customer_reviews.title: Nope, only lasted 4 months before malfunctioning
customer_reviews.text: After initially enjoying this remote, I am sad to report it has stopped syncing with the ps4. It lasted 4 months before my PlayStation stopped accepting its signal. Also, it eats up battery power at an alarming rate. I had to change the aaa batteries at least once every 3 weeks. It’s too bad, I would love a good remote for my ps4. The game controller is too sensitive to the touch for ps vue and dvd replay... a credit to Sony. The game controller rocks... for games.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Not the better choice.
customer_reviews.text: Far, far better than the other PDP Universal Remote for the PS4. Have experienced zero issues with this remote. No disconnections. No need to resend every two weeks. It just works consistently well. Update: 4 months in and this remote is completely dead. Just stopped working. Fresh batteries don't even light it up. What a waste.
customer_reviews.author: enigma_cipher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for those who use the PS4 as a media center
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great for my wife, who likes to use the PS4 for Amazon/Netflix/HBO but hates using the controller, especially with how easy it is to accidentally hit the trigger buttons on the controller causing things to rewind or fast forward. She can turn on the PS4, navigate the main menu, and control the apps without ever having to touch a controller. My only criticism is how close the arrow buttons are to the X/O/triangle/square. It's easy to hit the wrong button. They should have spaced them a little further apart. Otherwise this is a great little remote.
customer_reviews.author: REC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: after using this a while, i have to say it eats through batteries like crazy. i dont recommend this one, like the company didn't have it conserve battery life and shut itself off after X number of seconds of not using like other bluetooth controllers i've had in the past , because I went through 4 batteries in like one month? glad i bought rechargeable ones.
customer_reviews.author: B. Galligan

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted a simple remote that was better than using the Bravia link remote that came with my tv. The issue with that remote was the imprecise input. The PDP remote is responsive and I love that it has all the buttons from the PS4 controller. Sometimes it will screw up and register an extra directional input or one less than what I want, but I'm okay with that. I'd recommend this if you're looking for an official remote.
customer_reviews.author: Qsilver7850

customer_reviews.title: Absolute trash, waste of plastic, why are there no good PS4 REMOTES?
customer_reviews.text: Boy they sure saved their money making this hot pressed plastic garbage. If it isn't powered because the connectors are shoddy wires, it isn't paring because to do that you have to be "close to the PS4" - when is the last time that significant distance was a factor in pairing? Oh, probably because all the parts are dumpster parts collected off of the floor from some actual assembly plant. Holy jesus how is this the only PS4 "remote" that is available I swear if I had the money I'd make one and corner the market as these jackholes have done because I swear I'm not buying another one of these. T R A S H.
customer_reviews.author: J_C

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working after 4-5 Weeks
customer_reviews.text: I would caution against purchasing this remote control for your PS4. After about 4-5 weeks the remote began working only for 4-5 seconds at a time. I know that sounds ridiculous, but every time I start using the remote, it only successfully sends a signal to my PS4 for about 4-5 seconds. After that time, I can no longer control my PS4 with the remote. Either there is a defect, or it's poor design or quality. It's absolutely useless to me now, and it's past the return period so I can't get a refund or exchange. I'll never again buy another product made by this company.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Wickersty

customer_reviews.title: This is an "OK" alternative to using the game controller or the Official Universal Media Remote
customer_reviews.text: We switched from using the Official Universal Media Remote that has a TON of buttons you will literally never use to this much more simple media remote. And while it's compact design is far more desirable, I will warn anyone with larger fingers that the up, down, left and right buttons are recessed, which makes them harder to push without simultaneously pushing other buttons. You essentially have to use your fingertip to get an accurate selection the first time around. We are also noticing that the batteries already need replacing and we've had the remote for all of a month and a half.
customer_reviews.author: cristalynn84

customer_reviews.title: Won't connect, no light on the device as mentioned in the manual. Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: The manual says to hold the PS and Share buttons "until the red LED flashes" -- but there is no red LED anywhere on the remote. I tried anyway and it never connects. I though it was a case of bad batteries but I tried new ones and had the same issue. Seems like it's just dead on arrival. They should really update their manuals to remove the "flashing LED" part if they're going to completely remove the LED from the device.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Vogel

customer_reviews.title: You need this controller even if it isn't the best thing ever
customer_reviews.text: This controller is almost a must if you're using any sort of streaming service on the PS4 and are tired of putting down the controller and having the R2 button fast forward your movie into oblivion. I guess there are a few style issues that I could take issue with and sometimes it's not "natural" to use, but I love it and wouldn't do without it now.
customer_reviews.author: George R.E. Wacker

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended to buy this is a PlayStation 4 controller 2nd edition not the original
customer_reviews.text: This controller is not the original controller for the PlayStation 4 because a PS button on the controller should be a dead in the middle body is at the top that means this is a secondary controller I had to break it all the way down to the motherboard in order to figure out how to put the batteries in I did what it said my push-up it went go up so I had to separate the whole entire thing and almost not recommended to buy break at 2
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Richard G.Croop Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for media, weird directional button placement.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent must have device if you use your PS4 for Netflix or any other media. I used to use my PS4 controllers but they run out of battery after a few days and you have to power them back on. This remote turns back on immediately almost like a normal TV remote and just works. The only gripe I have is that the arrow buttons are in a weird spot relative to the circle, square, x, and triangle buttons. It took some time getting used to, but I used to accidentally press the circle button all the time when trying to press right on the directional pad. I wish they would switch the buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Buttons too tiny
customer_reviews.text: This remote works only for those small and dainty. This remote gets lost often in the couch. But the biggest frustration is the buttons are so small and close to each other that navigating YouTube, or streaming movies is difficult. It annoyed me so much, I bought a second remote that is bigger and easier to use. This one remains lost, while I use the other better universal media remote for my ps4.
customer_reviews.author: nibbyquilter

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Saves me from using the controller but buttons in the center are way too close together. Also wish it was illuminated and had volume controls. Decent quality though and comfortable in your hand. Wakes quickly from sleep mode.Battery life is not that great at all, especially seeing that it saves power by turning itself off.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I found this remote, it's so easy and convenient! I definitely recommend to anyone looking for a PS4 remote control. I haven't had any issues and since there aren't a lot of buttons it's super easy to use. Also, it shipped very quickly, I received it within 24 hours of placing the order. Super pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Carol's Friend

customer_reviews.title: Ordered this because we don't like using the controller to manage streaming programs
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this because we don't like using the controller to manage streaming programs. It connected easily enough and seems to work just fine. I wish it was a little larger, its pretty small and falls out of my hand easily it seems. Its also missing menu buttons like the PS3 remote we had. While you can easily hit the Square button to bring up the menu, I liked actually having a menu button.
customer_reviews.author: J. Vogt

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: Dislike: Very loud clicky buttons (not good when the wife is sleeping and I'm watching tv with the headphones on)and automatically connects when the PS4 is on. There are times when I'm gaming and didn't realize the remote connected and when I actually needed to use it, the batteries were dead. But, I removed the batteries when Im not using it and no real issue with that. Like: Its a solid remote, it doesn't feel cheaply made. The button layout is a bit odd at first, but you get the feel for it and can use it in the dark without mistakes. Purchase well spent for when there is a need for the remote.
customer_reviews.author: Icepicjoey

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work. I bought fresh new batteries and it still won't work. It will pair with the system. It will turn the system on and will let you log in, but after the main PlayStation screen comes up, it will not do anything. No matter what button you hit, nothing happens. So disappointed in this. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: J. Riddle

customer_reviews.title: Terrible layout, stops syncing to PS4 after a few months
customer_reviews.text: The button layout is a little hard to get used to. I wish the PS button was in the middle instead of the top and I always accidentally press the wrong button when I go to use the arrows. After about 3 months the controller started to have connectivity issues and would just die even with new batteries. Now even with fresh batteries I can’t get it to connect to my PS4 again. It seems like this product only lasts a few months before it totally dies out. I recommend the older version that is longer.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Sony PS4 media controllers are junk
customer_reviews.text: Quit working after 5 months with no warning. Will not connect and have tried two sets of new batteries. This actually lasted longer than the standard Sony PS4 remote by a few weeks but both are garbage. Sony should be ashamed. Construction is lightweight and cheap, the bottom portion comes apart too easily. Nowhere near as good as the PS3 media remote which has worked perfectly for many years.
customer_reviews.author: Grebs

customer_reviews.title: I hate this remote after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Save your money after 2 years of dealing with giving it commands 5 times in a row eats threw batteries I hate this remote so much save your self some money and buy the big one I never had a problem with that one to bad I gave it to my friend
customer_reviews.author: Ken Ross

customer_reviews.title: works very well
customer_reviews.text: at first it wouldnt connect, i dont think i was doing it right to begin with. i left it alone and tried to figure out what the problem was. after two days of thinking i decided to try it one more time thinking i got a defective remote but i finally did it right and it connected. the app in the PS store does not recognize it though but it does work now as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Rey

customer_reviews.title: Why have I been using the PS4 controller for so long?
customer_reviews.text: Have you been using your regular controller to watch PlayStation Vue? I did for years and everytime you bump anything with it the tv pauses or it goes into rewind or asks you to delete your favorited shows in the DVR, very frustrating. This remote is awsome it works just like the controller only not so delicate plus it’s Bluetooth and you don’t even have to point it right at the ps4 to change channels , it picks up from any direction. I should bought one of these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: KDW21

customer_reviews.title: connection problems
customer_reviews.text: Horrible experience. The remote connects then works for a few minutes then stops working. I go check on the Bluetooth devices on my playstation 4 and the remote is there but not connected. The only way for me to get the remote working again is by forgetting the device on my ps4 and reconnecting the remote all over again step by step only for it to work for a few minutes then disconnect. It's an endless cycle of uselessness. Overall I wouldn't recommend the remote feels cheaply made and it requires AAA batteries, a micro USB port would've made battery and connection between devices much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Arredondo

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Navigation via directional pad is awkward at best. The concentric ring of control keys and directional arrows is prone to mis-keying. That is, due to the design and narrow clearance, it's incredibly easy to press things unintentionally; however, the buttons do provide some frictional resistance in the attempt to mitigate mis-keying. Generally, a poor design but a well-made product.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B.

customer_reviews.title: Works OK but just not for me
customer_reviews.text: It works OKAY ... not too happy with it though, probably look at getting another one that is more spaced out, the UP/DOWN/LEFT/RIGHT keys are very sensitive and I constantly accidentally hit them when pressing one of the normal buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Myles

customer_reviews.title: Not a long lasting remote. Avoid unless cheap.
customer_reviews.text: These remotes worked great until they didn't. It no longer syncs. I contacted PDP support and they will only replace it under 2 years from purchase. Since most issues occur on that 3rd year, it's useless. I own two of these, one was a gift. The gifted one was same model but newer. It's within the warranty but since it was gifted I don't have a receipt. So no receipt then no warranty. I won't be using this brand again. Both remotes worked with my PS4 systems and then failed. I tried syncing them with other systems to test, both dead. You get one star for responsive support but zero stars for unresponsive remotes.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan F Lucas

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty... useless
customer_reviews.text: This remote would be closer to acceptable if it didn’t eat AAA batteries for breakfast. Unfortunately, I go through two batteries almost every two weeks. It’s affordable up front, but you’ll pay for it in the long run. On top of that, it just randomly stopped working recently. It will work through a handful of button clicks and then it just stops. The lights function, so I know it’s got juice. Media remotes are only convenient if they’re going to work consistently.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Kuhn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I use my PS4 to watch Blu-Rays discs, and if you do that, you'll eventually get tired of trying to navigate, pause, ffwd, etc using the game controller. You flick one wrong button on the game controller and next thing you know you are fast-forwarding your video and have to go searching for where you left off. This was definitely worth whatever it cost, as it is just like a regular DVD player remote. If you are going to watch video on your PS4, you want this remote. Tbh I think it should be included with the PS4.
customer_reviews.author: Pinkypants

customer_reviews.title: Batteries dead in a week - DO NOT BUY, unless you have rechargable AAAs.
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. Since this is a bluetooth device, it must always be running. Brand new batteries died in a week. I don't plan to replace batteries weekly, so I won't be using this. Unfortunately, I threw the box away before they died. Wish I could return. DO NOT BUY, unless you have rechargable AAAs.
customer_reviews.author: bglasier

customer_reviews.title: Works Very Well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this remote control because I stream Netflix, Hulu, Prime Video and YouTube on my PS4 and while using the Dualshock 4 controller works I used to drain the battery a lot even with the power saving feature turned on. I bought the remote control and paired it successfully and was ready in no time, it has all the buttons that the Dualshock 4 controller has, two AAA batteries lasts for months, highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: 60_Nice

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY PDP REMOTE CONTROLS-IT'S NOT WORTH THE HEADACHES
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THIS ITEM--WHY ? -IT DOES NOT HAVE A BATTERY COMPARTMENT-TO INSERT THE BATTERIES MY SECOND BAD EXPERIENCE WITH PDP REMOTE CONTROLS-THE FIRST MODEL WAS THE PDP UNIVERSAL MEDIA REMOTE CONTROL==THIS ITEM SHOOULD BE REPORTED TO SONY PLAYSTATION 4.COM-DO NOT BUY PDP ITEMS-IT'S COMPLETE JUNK. I CALLED AMAZON AND HOPEFULLY THEY WILL REPORT THIS ITEM OR REMOVE IT FROM THEIR WEBSITE. AMMZON WILL REFUND MY MONEY-THANK U AMAZON.
customer_reviews.author: MICHAEL CHIN

customer_reviews.title: It works, it doesn't work near as well as ...
customer_reviews.text: It works, it doesn't work near as well as the PS3 Sony remote. It's cheaply made, buttons are close and in a position I accidentally click on the wrong button while pushing the one I want. I miss my PS3 remote, But what can you do.
customer_reviews.author: FirehawkNS

customer_reviews.title: Don't get this model!
customer_reviews.text: Apparently there are two small PDP PS4 remotes. Both looking almost identical. I order this one by mistake because the look so similar. One is called media remote the other is called cloud remote. The media remote is a complete waste of money doesn't control volume or power of your TV. DON'T GET THIS MODEL, GET THE CLOUD PDP REMOTE.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Not so much
customer_reviews.text: After a month of kind of working. My remote stopped working at all. Very dissatisfied. Why Sony doesn’t make an official remote? I don’t know. But for now I’ll continue to use a game remote which is difficult for my family to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Moseley

customer_reviews.title: I’ve owned both ps4 remotes-the verdict
customer_reviews.text: Works well. I bought another ps4 universal remote previously. The previous one “burned out” and a few buttons ceased to function. It went through batteries quicklyt too. The reviews for this remote are pretty reliable. I’ve had it a few months now, and it continues to work well. Pairing is simple enough. The only reason why I didn’t give it 5 stars was because it does not control volume as it’s only for the ps4 and no other devices. I would recommend if you are on the fence and want to use another remote instead of the DualShock controller when just watching tv.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Great when your not playing games! Easy to hold. Wish it would work all the time.
customer_reviews.text: Useful and it works great for the most part. But every now and then it won't work. It does have a battery saver, that allows it to turn off after a certain time. It's then supposed to work if you push any button, at any time after it turns off. While off, it's supposed to do whatever function you pressed as soon as it turns back on. However i noticed when it's not working, it will work as long as I turn on one dual shock control. I wish it would work all the time! For this reason I'm giving 3 star, this issue takes away from fully enjoying it. Overall still nice to have.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much does its task, but it isn’t great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this remote for viewing movies, and it’s certainly better to use than PS4 remotes. With that said, I don’t exactly like disposing of normal batteries regularly, and I’m not sure why the remote wasn’t built to be rechargeable like normal PS4 remotes. Also, the top half of the remote is a pain to use for people with adult-sized fingers. Still, better than normal PS4 remotes when watching movies.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to our PS4
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been great. We've had no issues & the batteries seem to be doing fine. Only time will tell how it is in the long run but for now I'm glad we purchased it. It's a lot nicer to use when we use our PS4 for family viewing nights. I'd recommend this remote, so far it's been a great addition to our PS4.
customer_reviews.author: TacticalDad1911

customer_reviews.title: Parent friendly remote for PS4
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I needed this so my parents can use my PS4 for Netflix and Blurays. They had so much trouble with the dualshock controller, not knowing what the buttons were, accidentally bumping the joy sticks, watching a movie was a chore. The remote is essentially the same thing but they find it more user friendly. They can now watch movies with much less frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Adri

customer_reviews.title: Great if you use your PS4 as a media device a lot
customer_reviews.text: Works better than the HDMI linked TV remotes, and the PS button makes it much more useful because you can change apps. It shows up as a connected device on the PlayStation device list and shows the current battery level too which is a nice feature. I wish the play control buttons were better supported because they work in some apps but not others. The battery life on two AAA batteries is not great, they last 1-2 months depending on usage which is high for a remote control but understandable because it’s Bluetooth. At least they included batteries in the package. Price seemed a bit high, but totally worth it if you use your PS4 as your main media player.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lehmann

customer_reviews.title: Good. Could use slightly better button placement
customer_reviews.text: I like that this is smaller and has all the main functions. I don't like the placement of the arrow buttons being inside the other main buttons. It makes it awkward to use them. I feel like I'll wear them out quicker since I'm using my fingernail to hit them. If you have larger fingers this will be even more annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Bird, Las Vegas, Nv.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I love having a remote for the PS4 to watch movies. One little bump of the regular ps4 controller and your skipping scenes, rewinding, fast forwarding, etc......... my only complaint is that the arrows are too close to the ✖️0️⃣🔼⏹ buttons and sometimes you’ll hit them on accident. It’s still worth buying to rid yourself of the frustration of the dual shock watching movies
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Easy Enough for a Mother in Law
customer_reviews.text: This works very well and saves my controllers from being over-used and drained of power. I use rechargeable batteries and my wife finds this remote to be easier to use than a controller. So does my mother in law. Which means she comes over more often. Which is awesome because she is amazing and helpful so, this is more helpful than anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase for the price. After you get it connected to the PS4, it works seamlessly. Can do everything that you would normally do with a PS4 controller so far as watching things - I have not tried to play a game with it :)
customer_reviews.author: Cecily

customer_reviews.title: Great remote but needs to have larger buttons.
customer_reviews.text: I love the product and it is very well made. The only thing I think could be improved is the size of the buttons could be larger. I am a small women and have very small hands and fingers but it is not that easy to press the side to side and up and down buttons even with small hands. These buttons are used a lot when streaming. Otherwise the buttons are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Easy for the initial connection and also works well
customer_reviews.text: Easy for the initial connection and also works well. Only down side is similar to what others have said, the buttons for the directional ones are small and can be a problem if you have fat fingers. But then again, you only use those when you're browsing and navigating your library, once the movie or video starts you dont use those. Definitely recommend this for the price
customer_reviews.author: RHLLA

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Loved it until it stopped working for no reason after 4 months
customer_reviews.author: Glowoman

customer_reviews.title: Good for the 40 days it worked
customer_reviews.text: I honestly really liked this remote and loved how the batteries lasted way longer than using a regular controller. But, now after a little over 40 days of use it connects and works for 3 button presses. After that it is a brick. What a huge waste.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Battery Life is ridiculous short
customer_reviews.text: The battery life for this is ridiculous short. I bought this thinking I could save the battery life of my PS4 controller, only to have this thing's battery die within the week. This is not worth it. Just keep using your PS4 controller.
customer_reviews.author: AgroWander

customer_reviews.title: I wish it were back-lit.
customer_reviews.text: It's simple. It's easy. It works well. I've seen other reviews from people whining that it shuts off... And I don't understand why that's got their panties in a bunch. You're mad that it saves us own battery life to ensure you don't have to peel your butt off the couch? Press the PS button and it comes right back on again, ready to use.
customer_reviews.author: Dankphu

customer_reviews.title: The batteries die on this thing super quick. It's almost pointless to use with the ...
customer_reviews.text: The batteries die on this thing super quick. It's almost pointless to use with the amount of batteries consumed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it's supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: Since I mostly use my PS4 as a media player, I wanted a more traditional style remote as opposed to always using the controller. This remote does exactly what I expected it to do and it does it pretty well. The battery life could be better, but at the same time I'm also not going to go broke replacing a couple of AAA batteries every couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Build quality is also very good, and pairing was a breeze following the instructions
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed to use Netflix and Amazon Prime Video on my PS4. It also makes things easier for my girlfriend to use it, since she had never used a PS controller. Build quality is also very good, and pairing was a breeze following the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Feld

customer_reviews.title: Could be better, but usable
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Was happy to finally get a remote to use with my PS4. Useful for video apps (Netflix, Amazon Prime, Hulu, etc.) Cons: Battery hog, drains very quickly, change batteries often. Buttons are too small + too close together. Doesn't register clicks effectively, often misfires and hits the wrong button making navigation tedious at times.
customer_reviews.author: C.E.

customer_reviews.title: Best investment ever!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this remote after using the regular PS4 remote for years. As a millennial we use the PlayStation as the only streaming device for our TV in our living room. This remote is awesome! It is so much easier to deal with than the regular controller. No more accidentally rewinding or fast-forwarding. If you stream on your PlayStation then I highly recommend this remote. My best friend had the older version and we agree it is not as good but this new smaller one is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this purchase. It allows watching movies through the PS4 without having to use the expensive controllers. Does all functions on the PS4, when not playing games. Very helpful because replacing this remote due to overuse is MUCH more affordable than replacing a controller!
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, simple remote for PS4
customer_reviews.text: Perfect design, easy to use...soooo much better than the one Sony makes. I highly recommend this if you are looking for a nice and simply remote for your PS4. I much prefer using this than one of the PS4 controllers. Good stuff
customer_reviews.author: E.S.

customer_reviews.title: Remote
customer_reviews.text: I love this remote, it makes it so much easier to control my PS4. I only wish my puppy wouldn't have found it and used it as a chew toy.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Won't last
customer_reviews.text: Started eating AAA batteries alive within 3 months of light use. Multiple reports of this lead me to believe that this isn't a well made product. I got it for free with Amazon rewards points, and I think it's worth what I paid for it. It has a warranty, but I don't think it's worth half the price to send it in for replacement.
customer_reviews.author: David Bowman

customer_reviews.title: I should've bought this LONG AGO!
customer_reviews.text: I should've bought this LONG AGO! I'm not sure what other reviewers are talking about in regards to these remotes 'eating' batteries, mine has been running for a month without issue vs the alternative of having to constantly charge your controller instead. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dreamsupply

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Day 1 Review: Very simple to set up. Good compact design. Works perfectly. Installed 2 Duracell batteries, will continue to update review. 30 Day Review: Remote has had no issues. 60 Day Review: Still working great! I have not had to change the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I WISH I BOUGHT THIS YEARS AGO
customer_reviews.text: If you use your ps4 controls you know they will run out of battery EXTREMELY FAST. Enter this baby. Once you have it, you wont have to worry about controls running out of power for MONTHS! Buttons are a little small for my taste but you get used to it. Totally worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Felix Javier Puga

customer_reviews.title: Irritating
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this item. It works fine functionally, but it's impossible to navigate if you need to type in a quick password, and even worse at night because it doesn't illuminate. Someone really needs to check out the one that Xbox has. That is by far my favorite remote ever made.
customer_reviews.author: Arcadia DTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great product, poorly laid out in some aspects
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to set up. I kicked a star for the layout. The action buttons, square, circle, triangle and X are at N, S, E, and West and "inlaid" into the direction pad, making the use of the direction pad a crap shoot. About 50% of the time I end up hurting am action button by mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Sampson

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This remote really turned our PS4 into our Blu-ray player. The regular control was touchy and not designed to be a remote. This make watching DVDs and Blu-rays discs (yes we still watch disc media) much more easier. Quality construction and feel.
customer_reviews.author: M. Harp
